_header: Here beside dwelleth a rich barons daughter
Note:
Cf. Sidgwick (1903)
XSidgwick, Frank. Popular Ballads of the Olden Time. 3 vols. London: Bullen, 1903-06, 3. 211-16.
_description: The Juggler and the Baron’s daughter — fourteen long couplets and bob with two-line burden

OxfBal354.First Lines:
Here beside dwellithe as riche barons dowghterShe wold haue no man
                    þat for her love had sowght her…
OxfBal354.Last Lines:
…Send euery giglot of this town such an oþer lemanEvyn as
                    he wasExplicit
